primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Risen Christ overcomes the 'locked doors' of human doubt and isolation to bestow faith and peace upon the incompetent/resistant subject (Thomas/The Hearer).

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus turns directly to Thomas, singling him out.
Jesus actually grants to Thomas the signs which he so presumptuously had demanded.
the Lord looks up and out... speaking to you and to me.
personal trust in a living Lord
the One who gives faith, who confirms faith, who brings faith to completion
speaking to you and to me
Thomas, a mere human being who would now be entrusted
one person telling another, one bearing witness to another
through the word of this merely human witness
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.

tekstueel_bewijs: locked and bolted with iron gates pulled down over their fronts like mausoleums
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad mood, but the 'grave' and the 'ironbound' state of a heart that cannot believe on its own power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from receiving faith to bearing witness to others.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Thomas/Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witnessing) is a direct consequence of the primary program (Christ giving faith).

voorbeelden_god_subject: The appearance of Jesus transforms him completely.
The Lord looks up and out... and utters the last Beatitude.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Thomas stayed away, and he missed it!
We want to create our own conditions for faith.

voorbeelden: Do not be faithless, but believing (presented as invitation/gift rather than legal demand).
hope against hope draws us back.
Thomas realized that it was not needed for faith.
Jesus came through — and I mean through! — the door!
the One who gives faith... who brings faith to completion.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's power to overcome human inability. Faith is not something the hearer must 'do' (Devoir), but something Christ 'gives' (Pouvoir).

primaire_tegenstelling.s2: Death/The Grave (The Finality of Murphy's Law)

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death/Mausoleums) to ~S2 (The demand for signs) to S1 (Faith as a gift).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ bypasses the need for ~S2 (Seeing) by appearing as the Subject who grants S1 (Faith).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'shameful' and 'ironbound'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions Christ as the active agent who initiates the encounter, overcomes the locked doors of the heart, and bestows faith as a gift rather than a reward for effort.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The long description of the drive into NYC.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus’ willingness to meet Thomas’s conditions exposes the disciple’s effrontery far more effectively than any rebuke.
the One who gives faith, who confirms faith, who brings faith to completion.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Thomas is not used as a model to imitate, but as a mirror of human incompetence and the recipient of Christ's specific grace.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Thomas (as a recipient of grace, not a hero)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Christ seeks the doubter.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort; the burden of 'producing' faith is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the preacher's personal experience of 'deadness' to Thomas's 'deadness' to the hearer's 'deadness' is seamlessly resolved by Christ's intrusion.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'seeing' and 'believing' is resolved by defining faith as a gift from the Risen One.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the only One who has ever come back victorious from the grave

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the gift of faith directly to the Risen Christ rather than explicitly to the Spirit, though the function is pneumatological.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'locked door' and 'obstinacy' that only Christ can penetrate.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by Christ's movement toward the human. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of the Object (Faith).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it is appropriate for an Easter sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. The preacher successfully avoids the trap of making 'faith' a new work the hearer must perform.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the effective use of the NYC anecdote; Greimas shows that the anecdote functions as a semiotic marker of 'Death/S2' to set up Christ's intervention.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of John 20; Greimas focuses on the functional role of Thomas as the 'Incompetent Subject' transformed into 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'locked doors' are not just a setting, but an Actantial Opponent that only the Subject (Christ) can overcome.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Rutledge's own 'Grammar of Grace' applied to the Thomas narrative.
